definition: (coll.) one thousand or almost one thousand
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.english: This goods quite expensive, it can't be purchased under hundreds of money .
sentences.chinese: 那东西相当贵，没有千儿八百是买不会来的。

sentences.english: The thing is very expensive. If you don't have hundreds of money you can't buy it.
sentences.chinese: 那东西相当贵，没个千儿八百是买不回来的。

definition: ten thousand or almost ten thousand
about a hundred/a hundred or so
one yuan or less/around 80 cents or one dollar
to tire oneself out through overwork/to work oneself to death
private saved money of close family members
taking everything into account (idiom)/when all is said and done
high denomination of banknotes or coins/lots of money/a big sum (e.g. a bribe)
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
certainly/also written 一準|一准[yi1 zhun3]
to scrape together enough (people, money etc)
